titles.title: Waiving a requirement of clause 6(a) of rule XIII with respect to consideration of certain resolutions reported from the Committee on Rules.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-214, by Mr. Dreier.

The resolution waives clause 6(a) of rule XIII (requiring a two-thirds vote to consider a rule on the same day it is reported from the Rules Committee) against certain resolutions reported from the Rules Committee. The resolution applies the waiver to any resolution reported through the legislative day of September 30, 2011, relating to a measure making continuing appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2012.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 75.

action.text: Supplemental report filed by the Committee on Rules, H. Rept. 112-214, Part II.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 409.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 240 - 180 (Roll no. 721).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 238 - 182 (Roll no. 722).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 9/21/2011--Introduced. Waives a specified requirement of Rule XIII (Calendar and Committee Reports) to allow consideration of a measure making continuing appropriations for FY2012 on the same day it is presented to the House.
